stories.text:
Is there a cut-down/minimal version of Windows for running on servers with the absolute minimum unneeded process running?

I want to run some Window code with the absolute minimum additional processes consuming compute cycles.

Does such a version of Windows exist?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a cut-down/minimal version of Windows for running on servers?

stories.text:
This is year 2004 and I'm downloading big-buck-bunny.mp3.196k.zip on this new P2P software. Somehow it's reaching speeds double or triple what my 56K connection allows.

How is that possible? I distinctly remember trying some new application that was faster than what I used before and I couldn't understand how it could be so fast. Does anyone remember this happening? Unfortunately I don't remember what software it was exactly.
stories.title: Ask HN: How can my P2P software download faster than what my 56K should allow?
